channel.title: Some American worthies
channel.description:
Profiles of curious figures in the American past, based on diaries, journals and other books of personal record. The speaker is Robert E. Streeter, a professor of English at the University of Chicago.

An online collection of early educational public radio content from the National Association of Educational Broadcasters (NAEB).

item.title: John Ledyard, his trip to Siberia
item.description: A profile of 18th century American explorer and adventurer John Ledyard and his trip to Siberia.
item.dc:creator: University of Chicago
item.dc:subject: Travel & Leisure

item.title: Parson Weems, biographer
item.description: A profile of Parson Weems, the biographer of George Washington.
item.dc:creator: University of Chicago
item.dc:subject: Weems, M. L. (Mason Locke), 1759-1825. Life of George Washington

item.title: Samuel Sewall, Puritan judge
item.description: A profile of Samuel Sewall, a Puritan judge involved with the Salem witch trials.
item.dc:creator: University of Chicago
item.dc:subject: U.S. Literature

item.title: Elihu Burritt, the learned blacksmith
item.description: A profile of Elihu Burritt, an American diplomat, philanthropist and social activist who was nicknamed "The Learned Blacksmith."
item.dc:creator: University of Chicago
item.dc:subject: World Politics
